newsitem.title: GERMANY: German debt, futures firmer in yield-curve plays.
newsitem.headline: German debt, futures firmer in yield-curve plays.

text.p: German Bunds and futures ended dealings on Monday slightly firmer due to a firmer U.S. market and buying interest in the four- to seven-year area of the German yield curve, traders said.
DTB December Bund futures ended up seven basis points at 96.81 and traded within a range from 96.69 to 96.86 during a session with volume in Frankfurt under 40,000 contracts.
"The German market right now has a rather good orientation," said one Frankfurt trader. "It looks like we are heading toward 97.00 in December futures."
Dealers said the gains were more than just in futures.
